item.title: Eleanor add a quote by Steve Toltz
item.description: "I couldn't think of anything other than her and the components of her. For example, her red hair. But was I so primitive I let myself be bewitched by hair? I mean, really. Hair! It's just hair! Everyone has it! She puts it up, she lets it down. So what? And why did all the other parts of her have me wheezing with delight? I mean, who hasn't got a back, or a belly, or armpits? This whole finicky obsession serves to humiliate me even as I write it, sure, but I suppose it isn't that abnormal. That's what first love is all about. What happens is you meet a love object and immediately a hole inside you starts aching, the hole that is always there but you don't notice until someone comes along, plugs it up, and then runs away with the plug." -- Steve Toltz

item.title: Eleanor add a quote by Steve Toltz
item.description: "[I'll teach you] how not to leave the windows of your heart open when it looks like rain and how everyone has a stump where something necessary was amputated. " -- Steve Toltz

item.title: Eleanor add a quote by Steve Toltz
item.description: "After all, memory may be the only thing on earth we can truly manipulate to serve us, so we don't have to look back at ourselves in the receding past and think, What an arsehole!" -- Steve Toltz

item.title: Eleanor add a quote by Armistead Maupin
item.description: "If you want to know who the oppressed minorities in America are, simply look at who gets their own shelf in the bookstore. A black shelf, a women's shelf, and a gay shelf." -- Armistead Maupin

item.title: Eleanor add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "I don't think..." then you shouldn't talk, said the Hatter." -- Lewis Carroll
